column1: it would not be possible in an application for judicial review to inquire into and determine the merits
of such allegation. However, I am inclined to agree with the position taken up by the learned State
Counsel that the charge against the 1st Petitioner was of a serious nature considering his status as
Principal of the Pirivena, and that the Respondents were entitled to raise such a matter, in view of
the observations made in the log entry (‘P6d’).
